Abstract
The concept of a tness formula as a property of an organism is proposed. In
arti cial life simulations with organisms living in an environment, the tness formula
can be interpreted as the ability of organisms to extract energy from potential food
sources distributed in the environment. In simulations where the goal of the genetic
algorithm is that of developing systems which exhibit a certain type of behavior in a
particular environment, the tness formula becomes an independent v ariable which c a n
be manipulated in order to obtain the desired behavior. The tness formula can be
viewed as an evolvable trait of organisms, and therefore not xed and decided by the
researcher. Simulations with xed and evolvable tness formulae show that the tness
formula, the sensory apparatus, and the behavior of organisms may co-evolve a n d b e
co-adapted.
